newsitem.title: MEXICO: Sidek investments hinge on debt plan.
newsitem.headline: Sidek investments hinge on debt plan.

text.p: The head of steel and tourism firm Grupo Sidek said on Friday any new investments by the group hinged on approval of a debt restructuring due to be presented to creditors by November.
Asked about news reports that Sidek subsidiary Simec would invest $20 million next year, Sidek director general Luis Rebollar Corona told Reuters, "The figure depends on the restructuring accord."
"I would wait to have the restructuring approved. If everything is approved, we'll do it; if they don't approve it, we won't do anything."
Simec makes steel and aluminum products and it has 65 percent of the Mexican three-inch girders market.

Sidek, which suspended debt payments in February, has been working on a debt restructuring plan since. Rebollar says its completion has been delayed by the need to satisfy the interests of both Mexican and foreign creditors.
